children.subject: Probably in the second semester, so that you can find out what a ridiculous workload it'll be before you do it. Even three technical courses and a breadth is a lot, for any semester. I can't imagine doing ~16 technical units and a breadth on top of that. I get it, I'm a transfer too; we don't have much time here and we want to make the most of it. Relax a bit, though. Unless you're incredibly talented and have a prodigious work ethic, you're likely to burn out just with your plan as it is. Don't ensure that by adding another CS class on top of it.

I know you didn't ask this, but I would give serious consideration to retaking the CS61B class, if you took the class at a community college. Do it after you've declared, if you must.

If you went to a community college, I would also give consideration to taking the American Institutions class at that community college over the summer rather than occupying a slot in the Spring.

history.content:
Semester 1: CS 61A, CS 70, EE 16A, ASAMST 128AC

Note: I can taken EE 16A for P/NP as I have done the Math 54 equivalent at my community college. I'm electing to do 16A instead of 16B because I have no electrical engineering background.

Semester 2: CS 61C, EE 16B, INFO 213, American Institutions Course

I currently am leaning towards putting 47B in Semester 2, as 4 STEM classes at once in my first Semester feels like it would be a lot.
history.subject: Where should I place CS 47B in my next two semesters? (Transfer student going into junior year)
